Badak di Taman Nasional Way Kambas Dapat Kandang 120 Ha
02 Nov 2019, 05:00 by Antara, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kandang badak di Pusat Penangkaran Badak Sumatera di Taman Nasional Way Kambas (TNWK) Kabupaten Lampung Timur bertambah luas 120 hektare.
Peresmian kandang badak baru itu dilaksanakan di Pusat Penangkaran Badak Sumatera atau Suaka Rhino Sumatera, Lampung Timur, Rabu, 30 Oktober 2019.
Kepala Balai TNWK Subakir mengatakan luas kandang badak yang baru diresmikan 120 hektare. Adapun kandang yang lama luasnya 100 hektare.
Subakir menjelaskan fasilitas dalam kandang baru itu tidak jauh berbeda dengan kandang badak yang lama.
"Terdapat lima kandang, masing-masing kandang badak luasnya 20 hektare, sisanya sebagai tempat kawin badak (reproduksi)," ujarnya.
Subakir mengungkapkan, kandang badak yang baru diresmikan itu bakal diisi badak hasil tangkapan dari hutan.
"Akan ada penangkapan badak baru dari alam, dimasukan dalam kandang ini," ujarnya.
Subakir menyebutkan, ada tiga badak tangkapan yang akan ditangkarkan dalam kandang baru itu.
"Ada tiga ekor, dua betina dan satu jantan," ujarnya.
Dia berharap,adanya penambahan luas kandang itu,badak sumatera populasinya terus bertambah.
"Adanya kandang baru ini diharapkan badak bertambah banyak populasinya," ujar dia.
Pada peresmian itu, dilakukan pelepasan badak sumatera "Harapan" ke dalam kandang badak yang baru tersebut.
Direktur Keaneragaman Hayati dan Konservasi Kementerian Lingkungan Hidup dan Kehutanan Indra Exploitasia mengatakan kementeriannya berharap adanya kandang badak baru itu bisa membawa badak sumatera berkembang biak dan hidup lestari dalam habitat aslinya.
Indra menegaskan Kementerian LHK bertugas tidak hanya menyelamatkan satwa badak sumatera di Lampung, namun juga menyelamatkan populasi badak yang terdapat di Aceh dan Kalimantan.
"Tugas kami ini tidak hanya untuk menyelamatkan badak sumatera saja, tapi menyelamatkan populasi satwa lainnya, seperti harimau sumatera," ujar dia.
Gubernur Lampung Arinal Djunaidi mengatakan populasi badak sumatera saat ini tersisa 80 ekor.
Persebaran badak sumatera di Lampung, kata Gubernur, terdapat dalam kawasan Hutan Way Kambas dan kawasan Taman Nasional Bukit Barisan Selatan.
Sehubungan itu, Gubernur meminta kepada kepala balai kedua taman nasional itu dan semua pihak melindungi hutan berikut isinya.
"Hutan dua taman nasional ini harus kita jaga dari orang yang merusak. Kepada kedua kepala balai dan petugas lainnya, jaga hutan dan lakukan patroli, orang yang merusak hutan beri hukuman yang setimpal," ujar dia.
Gubernur juga berharap kepada KLHK bisa menginisiasi nota kesepakatan bersama melindungi hutan dengan Pemerintah Provinsi Lampung, Polda Lampung dan Korem 043 Garuda Hitam Lampung.

Rhinoceros in Way Kambas National Park Can Kandang 120 Ha
02 Nov 2019, 05:00 by Antara, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The rhino enclosure in the Sumatran Rhinoceros Captive Center in Way Kambas National Park (TNWK) in East Lampung Regency has expanded by 120 hectares.
The inauguration of the new rhino enclosure will take place at the Sumatran Rhino Captive Breeding Center or Sumatran Rhino Sanctuary, East Lampung, Wednesday, 30 October 2019.
Head of the Subakir National Park TNWK said the area of the newly inaugurated rhino cage was 120 hectares. The old cage is 100 hectares wide.
Subakir explained the facilities in the new cage were not much different from the old rhino cage.
"There are five cages, each rhino cage covering an area of 20 hectares, the rest as a breeding place for rhino (reproduction)," he said.
Subakir revealed, the newly inaugurated rhinoceros cage will be filled with catches from the forest.
"There will be a new rhino catch from nature, put in this cage," he said.
Subakir said there were three catching rhinos to be captive in the new cage.
"There are three tails, two females and one male," he said.
He hoped, with the addition of the area of the cage, the Sumatran rhino population continues to grow.
"The existence of this new cage is expected to increase the rhino's population," he said.
At the inauguration, the Sumatran rhino "Harapan" was released into the new rhino enclosure.
Director of Biodiversity and Conservation of the Ministry of Environment and Forestry Indra Exploitasia said his ministry hoped that the presence of the new rhino enclosure could bring Sumatran rhinos to breed and live sustainably in their natural habitat.
Indra emphasized that the LHK Ministry was tasked not only with saving the Sumatran rhino in Lampung, but also saving the rhino population found in Aceh and Kalimantan.
"Our task is not only to save the Sumatran rhino, but also to save other animal populations, such as the Sumatran tiger," he said.
Lampung Governor Arinal Djunaidi said the Sumatran rhino population currently has 80.
The distribution of the Sumatran rhino in Lampung, said the Governor, is in the Way Kambas Forest area and the Bukit Barisan Selatan National Park area.
In this connection, the Governor asked the head of the two national parks' centers and all parties to protect the forest and its contents.
"The forests of these two national parks must be protected from people who damage. To the two head of the hall and other officers, guard the forest and patrolling, people who destroy the forest give the punishment accordingly," he said.
The governor also hopes that KLHK can initiate a memorandum of understanding together to protect the forest with the Lampung Provincial Government, Lampung Regional Police and Military Black Lampung Military Command 043.
